text: 440ml Can - Hazy orange in colour. Mango, passion fruit and lychees in the aroma. Mango, melon, peach, grapefruit, pineapple, strawberry and apricot in the taste. Tangy and Juicy.

Can shared at muckfest. The beer is a hazy gold with a white head of foam. The aroma is floral and has citrus notes. Big paper and dried herbs in the aroma and taste. Mild bitterness. Medium body and medium carbonation.
440ml can at V-Rev, Manchester. Typical cloudy brew, lots of citra hop aroma. A lot of flavour, and light for the strength. Big yeasty aftertaste.
Can thanks to Colon. Pours a cloudy gold with medium white head that lasts. The aroma is earth, dank, grapefruit pith. Medium body, grapefruit pith, grass, yeast, bitter finish, very good.

June 17, 2017. Can at home. 
Cloudy yellow/orange with a small dense white head. Aroma is very fruity with orange, peach, apricot, grapefruit, a touch of pine. Taste is medium sweet, juicy and fruity, smooth medium bitterness. Medium bodied, smooth texture with soft carbonation. Finish is fruity with a smooth but distinct zesty bitter finish, sweet tropical fruits. 
Great one.

Can courtesy of Sander (thanks man!); shared at As Is. Pours a deep, milky orange body with thick white lacing. Nose is sweet citrus, melon, pool toy and mangoes. Mouthfeel is medium to full bodied with notes of sweet mango/melon, papaya, citrus, mosaic funk and soft sugars.

Can at THT. Very cloudy yellow colder with small white head. Looks like juice. Massive dank citra hops on the nose, smells really good! Sweet mango, orange, strong dank marijuana, sweet sugary malts, light hop burn. Lovely hops here! Medium sweet, under medium bitter. Over medium bodied with creamy feel and light burning finish.

Sampled at the June THT. Super hazy golden pour with a white head. Notes of citrus, tropical fruit - pineapple, mango, passion fruit - dank hops, light onions. Medium body and carbonation and a juicy yeasty texture. Good!

Sampled from can at THT June at kwartje. Murky golden with thin white head. Sweet malts, marijuana, citrus peels, tropical fruit. Moderate sweet and light bitter. Over medium body and soft carbonation.
Backlog z Mikkeller Beer Celebration Copenhagen 2017. Multiwitaminowa bomba z totalnie pysznÄ…, owocowÄ… goryczkÄ….
Can thanks to Clownoisseur- pours murky gold white head - nose and taste of creamy oats, juicy oranges, nectarine, grapefruit pith and biscuit malt - medium body

Aroma is pure mango and pineapple juice with a superjuicy attitude. Pine oil draws attention as well. The mouthfeel is pure, thick mango juice with a sharper citrus sting and general tropical sweetness. ItÂ’s sweet i would say, but the hop sting brings it down and thereÂ’s actually a small tad of alcohol in the end. This was a pure mouthgasm, and the only thing I can say is not superb is that late alcohol sting, otherwise it would have been a pure fiver.
From tap at MBCC 2017. A hazy golden coloured beer with a white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, hops, fruit, citrus, peach, grapefruit and with a bitter finish.

500 mlCan .Cloudy golden beer with small head. Aroma of mango,pulped fruit, tutti frutti, grapefruit and faint lemon. Taste is melon,lots of mango,grapefruit, tropical fruits, citrus . Juicy and chewy. best dipa I have ever had.
From tap. Hazy golden color with white head. Hoppy and malty aroma, citrusy fruity, tropical fruits, grass. Sweet and bitter fruity taste. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

Can from Gary. Many thanks! Pours a peach color...looks like juice. Copper hues and a finger of off-white head breaks into light lace. Aromas are of fresh hop pellets...like an open bag of mosaic and citra! Light peach, light oat and orange peel. Taste follows with a nice bouquet of melon, peach, pineapple, orange juice... cereal note...light sweet...tiny bitter...alchohol completely hidden. Pillowy mouthfeel pushes this hop bomb. Finishes semi dry and incredibly smooth. Big fan of this one.

MBCC. Hazy yellow with small off-white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hops, citrus, little juicy and a little grapefruit. Flavour is malt, fruit, hops, citrus, little juicy, little grapefruit, medium sweet, little peach, hop pellets and medium bitter.

Draught @ MBCC 2017. Pours hazy yellow with a white head, lacings. Aroma of malt, rich hops, grassy, fruity, citrus, grapefruit, grapefruitpeel. Flavor is bitter, light sweet, malt, grassy, fruit, citrusly. Medium to full body, average to lively carbonation, dry and lasting bitter finish. 120517

Can, man. Cloudy yellow pour with a white head. Big citrus bouquet. Huge citrus notes blend seamlessly with delicious caramel malts. Really good for sure. Above average body and mouthfeel. Impressive.

Can. Murky tan body with white head. Aroma is wonderful tropical fruits pines apricots with some malts in the background. Taste is sweet fruits with oranges grapefruit and malts with hints of alcohol. Aftertaste is perfect balanced. Great one.

Can. Pours murky muddy Golden with a White head. Tropical fruity, oats, slight yeast and an herbal Dry touch. Reasonable bitter finish. Juicy fruit. Tasty and intriguing with the alcohol dangerously non appearing.

Tap at Craft Beer Tuesday. Pours hazy amber. Aroma is strong tropical fruit, light grass, but really mostly fruit. Mango, pineapple, lemon. Body is heavy, sweet and fruity, with only a low bitterness but a sprizzy lively carbonation. Lots of hop pellet spice, quite dank. Long fruity palate. Very good, but not quite outstanding.

440 ml can from Eebria online shop. It pours cloudy, hazy, intense orange with a nice white head that quickly disappears. Aroma is big hoppy and big fruity. Lot of tropical fruits, mango, papaya, passion fruit. And then citrus, orange, peach, apricot. Very very juicy. Taste is medium sweet and so so fruity and good. Body is full, texture is thick, juicy, carbonation is average. Mouthfeel is amazing. Finish is fruity, long, sweet. Alcohol perception is minimal despite the 9% ABV. Another great beer from this brewery!

Appearance- thick, murky, pulpy orange juice, lots of carbonation, a half-finger fizzy off-white head. Aroma- tropical fruit, orange, pineapple, papaya, pithy fruit, stewed hops, more fruit. Aroma- thick fruit juice, freshly squeezed orange juice, pineapples, grapefruit, mango, hop resin, bitter hop traces on top of sweet fruit, thick malty undertones, oniony traces, fizzy alcoholic fruit juice, abv very well-disguised. Superb as always.

Can as gift from my good friend Richthevillan, cheers Rich. Cloudy golden beer with large head. Aroma of pulped fruit, tutti frutti, grapefruit and mango. Taste is grapefruit, light sugar, tropical fruits, citrus, grapefruit flesh and resin. Juicy and chewy. World class, 2nd best beer I have ever had.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Can from WP Claus at home. Pours a hazy golden with a tiny white head. Sweet with a mellow bitterness. Aromas of lemon and lime with lots of exotic fruits to the mix. Hints of alcohol. Medium to full bodied. Medium carbonation. Dry finish with lemony, but not sour finish.

Can, looks like best before 08-2017. Murky yellow/orange with a small off white head. Heavy hoppy nose, also fairly juicy with papaya, sweet melon, light honey and candied citrus. Some fat cheesy note too. The flavour is fruity with melon, papaya, dust, hay, light honey and citrus. Milky texture, medium sweet and bitter. Mild warming finish. Carries the alcohol really well and drinks all too easy.
On tap @ Edinburgh Beer Festival. Strong citrusy aroma, dark orange hue, lemons, oranges in the taste with medium sweetness to offset tartness.
Grapefruit aroma with similar citrus taste and a sweet, tart finish. Just a hint of bitterness. A little too much citrus for me personally, but definitely refreshing.

[5/12/17] Draught at Mikkeller Beer Celebration Copenhagen 2017. Blue session. Murky yellow. Fruity hops aroma, tropical, juicy, a bit oniony. Flavor has light sweetness, yeast, and bitter fruity, "green" and oniony hops.
From tap. Pours hazy yellow, small white head. Aroma is grapefruity and solid hoppy. Smooth fruity, crisp hoppy. Lingering citrusy and smooth fruity. Lingeribg hoppy and fruity far finish.
Can. Pours murky orange gold. Aroma of mango, orange, pine and apricot. Medium sweet with low bitterness. Another big juicy, fruity and easy drinking cloudwater. Excellent as is now the norm.
Keg at ecbf 2017. Pours murky orange, nose is dank, shortbread, citrus, taste is juicy citrus, sweet, toffee

Can 0.44l bottled on 17th april, BBE june 2017@: pours straw like, pale yellow, cloudy, with dissipating white / off-white head. Aroma: intense hop character with notes of citruses; especially grapefruit, tangerine, oranges, mango, pinneaple...flavour follows aroma: intense hop profile with fruity character, supported with crisp, biscuit like malt backbone. Hop bitterness is medium to high, fruity bitterness lingers in aftertaste. Body is medium, texture juicy smooth, carbonation is moderate.
@Basunen 17-5-27: lite juiceaktig med en diskret humle. Ok trevlig men saknar det sista.

A 440ml can, canned on 27th April 2017 and with a best before date of end of June 2017. Poured into a Lost Abbey teku glass. It was a cloudy, mango juice dark orange colour with a thin white head and sparse lacing. Aromas of tropical mango and papaya followed by citrusy orange and orange rind with a hint of grapefruit and pineapple. Tastes of juicy mango, pineapple and orange with light bitterness, dankness and a lingering tingly spice on the finish. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Overall a very nice DIPA from Cloudwater that is both juicy and intense.

Keg at BrewDog, Clapham, London in May 2017 - Murky orangey gold in colour. Medium foamy white head. Good lacing. Looks like a fruit smoothie. Aroma of a fruit smoothie. Very Fruity. Sweet tropical and citrus fruity; peach, mango, melon, pineapple, orange, grapefruit. Balancing piney hop bitterness. Bit spicy. Toasty malts. Alcohol barely noticeable. Nice fruit / hop balance. Bittersweet very tropical and citrus fruity and hoppy throughout. Enjoyed this a lot. Terrific mega fruity DIPA. (2017-05)
Mbcc blue. Yellow hazy. Juicy fruity nose. Light pines. Med bodied, pretty nice bitter sweetness ratio balance here. Juicy fruity piney flavour. Nicely intense.

Can from Hop Burns & Black. Colour is like fruit juice. Opaque, cloudy, orange amber juice, with a medium dirty white foam head. Nose is huge citrus rind, grapefruit, then tropical fruit mango, chalky minerals, huge pine, slight nylon hop alpha acid takeover. Body is fruit juice, thick and luscious. Taste is mango, pine, grapefruit rind, minerals, maybe bit of lime and lemon, earthy. Think I like this more than the others...

Chmiele:  Citra, Simcoe, Huell Melon, Mosaic, Piligrim Alpha 
 Data puszkowania:  17.04.2017 
 Data waÅ¼noÅ›ci:  31.06.2017 
 Kolor:  PrzepiÄ™kny pomaraÅ„czowo-brzoskwiniowy kolor. Piwo jest mÄ™tne i gÄ™ste jak kisiel. 
 Piana:  Ten element mnie trochÄ™ zawiÃ³dÅ‚. Piana jest po prostu sÅ‚abiutka.
Zaraz po przelaniu do szkÅ‚a redukuje siÄ™ z prÄ™dkoÅ›ciÄ… wystrzaÅ‚u z karabinu maszynowego.
Opada do milimetrowego Å‚aÅ„cuszka.
Po paru chwilach i on znika bez powrotu.
Trudno okreÅ›liÄ‡ jej kolor i strukturÄ™. 
 Zapach:  Nie mogÅ‚em siÄ™ juÅ¼ doczekaÄ‡ tego aromatu. Zapach bardzo przyjemny, trwaÅ‚y.
Pierwsze skojarzenia to cytrusy: Å›wieÅ¼e, dojrzaÅ‚e mandarynki, pomaraÅ„cze i grejpfruty. Potem kapka melona i anansa.
W drugim rzucie sporo iglastych, leÅ›nych klimatÃ³w.
Na koniec zioÅ‚owa woÅ„ i potem znowu chmiel.
Aromat nie odpuszcza nawet na chwilÄ™. Po przelaniu do szkÅ‚a nie traci na intensywnoÅ›ci. 
Rewelacja! 
 Smak:  W smaku intensywne, bogata i niewiarygodnie soczyste. Poziom conajmniej Stigbergets Bryggeri i ich flagowego GBG Beer Week, tylko Å¼e tamto to standardowa wersja, a tutaj mamy podwÃ³jnÄ….
Piwo miaÅ¼dÅ¼y intensywnoÅ›ciÄ… owocÃ³w cytrusowych. CaÅ‚e kilogramy grejpfrutÃ³w, mandarynek, pomelo, ananasÃ³w i melonÃ³w rozpÅ‚ywajÄ… siÄ™ po jÄ™zyku i podniebieniu.
Å»ywica skapuje po krawÄ™dziach szkÅ‚a niczym po korze drzewa sosnowego.
Niesamowite zioÅ‚owe posmaki doskonale wspÃ³Å‚grajÄ… z krÃ³tkÄ…, Å¼ywicznÄ… goryczkÄ….
Goryczka jest niewiarygodnie harmonijna. Znika jeszcze przed kolejnym Å‚ykiem. Tekstura jak wyÅ¼ej wspomniaÅ‚em przypomina kisiel owocowy.
Tak rewelacyjne ukrycie procentÃ³w moÅ¼e przyprawiaÄ‡ o zawrÃ³t gÅ‚owy. DoskonaÅ‚a pijalnoÅ›Ä‡.
Genialny trunek! Klasa Å›wiatowa. 
 Wysycenie:  Åšrednie. 
 Podsumowanie:  

No Moi Drodzy! RoÅ›nie wielki konkurent dla takich gigantÃ³w jak Pliny The Younger z Russian River Brewing Company, czy Heady Topper z The Alchemist.
Dla mnie poza lanym Pliny w Russian River w Santa Rosa to jest najlepsze Double IPA jakie piÅ‚em.
Co tak na prawdÄ™ wyrÃ³Å¼nia go w tÅ‚umie?
Nieprawdopodobna soczystoÅ›Ä‡, niewiarygodne ukrycie procentÃ³w, balans poszczegÃ³lnych skÅ‚adowych i duÅ¼e natÄ™Å¼enie chmielu, przy jednoczesnym zachowaniu krÃ³tkiej, harmonijnej goryczki. 
Rewelacyjne piwo bez dwÃ³ch zdaÅ„. Uczta dla moich kubkÃ³w smakowych.

DziÄ™ki raz jeszcze Kamil R. za to piwko ;-)))
15/20 Not as good as v13 but still pretty great. Really juicy and fresh. Very murky.
Can, tnx angst. Pours cloudy orange amber with a small head. Aroma is tropical fruits hop juice. Flavor is juicy hoppy fruity fresh nicely bitter. Tasty in other word.

A: Deep cloudy orange/yellow coloured with a thin white head N: Passionfruit, orange, pineapple, mango, papaya, hint of pine T: Mango, papaya, orange, hint of liqourice O: Quite sweet taste with loads of tropical fruit on the nose. ItÂ’s good.

Hugely dense murky yellow hazy.
Potent nose.
Initial short start.
Full body.
Dank ripe ropic fruit.
Some sweetness followed by potency.
Greatness.

UPDATED: JUN 3, 2017 Can from Hops and Crafts Exeter. Pours thick murky hazy orange with a rapidly diminishing off white head. Aroma of mango,blood orange,papaya,light grapefruit & pineapple. Juicy Taste of blood orange,papaya ,pineapple,mango ,pine with passion fruit & melon. Light bodied ,spritzy,dry ,soft mouthfeel with nice bitterness the finish has more blood orange ,mango & juicy fruit . Top beer!

Tap. Cloudy golden body with a small white head. Aroma of citrus, tropical fruits, peach, melon notes and lime zest. Sweet flavor that ends up being more dry and bitter. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. An excellent DIPA. ðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸ

44cl can via Ales by Mail. It pours exactly like thick OJ with a small yellow-ish head. Aroma is big bold tropical fruits notes and weed, nicely balanced. Taste is also rich and sweet, well balanced out by the danky grassiness. More mango and pineapple notes. Full bodied with good carbonation. Overall, top tier
MBCC. Very hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and rather hoppy - citrus and fruity. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish. 120517

Can, major thanks to Leighton. Aroma is grapefruit, papaya, mango, tangerine jooooze. Flavor is berries, fruited loveliness, frothy fruity dankness, citrus, apricot, pine. Medium bodied exceptionally expressive, dank DIPA.

Keg at the Hanging Bat. Pours pure murky yellow with a thin white head. Aromas of mango smoothie, lime zest, pineapple juice. Taste is juicy, some light bitterness, pithy at the end. Nice. Easy drinking.

Keg at Brewdog Aberdeen. Roast pineapple and mango aroma, cloudy, creamy and chewy and lingering hops. ItÂ’s great stuff...though I drank it alongside the NE DIPA Mosaic and I was hoping for a more discernible difference.

Thnx to vincent ! Pours very unclear yellow, small white head fades fast. Smell is intensely fruity, melon , crisp, citrussy. Taste is very intense, straight hop-to-the-face. Intensely fruity, medium, fitting bitterness. Light aspects of white pepper. Very easy drinker, intense taste , yet perhaps a bit one dimentionnal. Great ipa, but at the current rating, I expected more.

From can thanks to Bursprak. Pours a cloudy, bright yellow with a creamy white head. Aroma has intense citra hops and estery yeast that together gives notes of honey dew, papaya, slight spices, light citrus, lots of tropical fruits. Taste has a fairly high sweetness, light bitterness, light minty, fresh and super easy drinking. Fluffy body and an average carbonation.

Can. Pours a deep hazy orange with a fading thick white head. Aroma is of orange, zesty, grapefruit rind, exotic fruits, pineapple, mango, passionfruit, papaya. Taste is of citrus, orange, exotic fruits, grapefruit. Foamy oily mouthfeel, medium carbonation.

Can at home, 20th May 17. Pours a cloudy light orange. Aroma is huge, tropical fruit, citrus and explosion. Taste is citrus, tropical fruit, bitter, and more so than the series, which is my preference, almost a slight numbing of the palate and tongue from the hops. The bitterness and huge flavours linger like a chilli burn in the mouth. Incredible and remarkable job from Cloudwater, their best so far in the DIPA series.

Pours hazy orange with a firm medium height white head. Aroma is tropical fruits. Taste is peach sweet, mango sweet, orange sweet, tropical fruit sweet. Bitterness is non-existent. An incredible interpretation of a NEIPA.
UPDATED: MAY 22, 2017 Juicy appearence, aroma very intensive you can smell the hops far away from glass, fruity, tasty absolutely drinkable with intense and fortunetaly short bitterness. Awesome
Absolutely bursting with fresh tropical fruit, in both aroma and flavour. No trace of the 9% abv at all. Delicious

Can from mchughs. Pours murky thick cut orange juice. White head. Aroma is citrus, orange juice, lemon, peach, mango, tropical fruit notes. Flavour is caramel sweet with orange, melon, peach juice. Moderate grapefruit bitterness. So drinkable itÂ’s scary for abv.

Can from Bridgend Services, Freuchie. Pours with a seriously murky mango juice vibe. Minimal head. Loads of musky ripe tropicality. Light orange juice. Light grapefruit oil. Lots of mango. Strawberry Starburst. Taste has loads more tropicality with a little peach juice also. Chewy Irn-Bru candy bar sweetness with a bit of tang. Powerful resinous bitterness follows that nudges that juice to the side for a bit. Grapefruit pith. A touch of warming alcohol. Juicy finish with a balancing backbone of bitterness. Full, pillowy mouthfeel. Gentle carbonation but still with enough spritz. World class.

On tap in BrewDog, Stirling. Pours very hazy yellow, little to no head. Fantastic aroma of fresh squeezed lime, mandarin, clementine and grapefruit, along with other tropical fruits, a little bit of mango and pineapple. Bloody orange taste dominate in the flavor, nicely balanced with resin, spruce, herbal and pine bitterness. Aftertaste if fresh and juicy with a forest like hint. Texture is slightly creamy and thick, carbonation is very pleasant. Citra aroma reach the plateau in this super well brewed IPA.

Keg at Brewdog Doghouse, Glasgow in the company of Nick and Anna Friday 19th May 2017  Pours the colour of orange squash and just as cloudy with a filmy white head. Wow this just makes me want to sing Â’club tropicana drinks are freeÂ’, really tropical,
 Juicy, soft and fruity, soft mouthfeel, mango and pineapple, wonderful, really good.  A7 A4 T9 P5 Ov16 4.1
Can @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Deep golden hazy pour with a light head. Notes of juicy fruits, mangoes and pineapple with a light bitterness.

Keg @ Brewdog Brum. Pours a hazy golden yellow, frothy white head. Good exotic fruit nose, floral, some grapefruit. Taste is full-on exotics, not too dissimilar to the NE DIPA. Super fruity, bordering on overly rich, some sulphur once again on the finish, but still rather enjoyable.

Can thanks to Bursprak. Pours unclear hazy orange with a white head. Aroma of mango juicy, orange, papaya, pineapple, melon and mellow citrus. Wow! Taste of mango, mellow citrus, pineapple, dank hops, sweet orange and overall tropical. Wow!
Can thanks to bursprak. Pours hazy deep orange with a small white head. Aromas of citrus, orange, mango, light malty notes, herbal. Taste is sweet, mango, herbal hops, pineapple, bitter finish.

Pours cloudy light orange with a moderate white head. Aromas of mango, peach, apricot, citrus, resin. Taste is very fruity and somewhat bitter with grassy notes. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation.

Can from the Good Spirits Co. Wine & Beer. Pours an opaque milky orange with a decent froth. Nose is intense, mandarin, sweet tropical fruits, and loads of dank green earthy hops. Taste is sweet, soft, and easy, with a ton of fruit and then woody bitterness in the finish. Palate is rich, but very well balanced, with no over alcohol and a clean bitter finish. Another fantastic beer from Cloudwater.
UPDATED: MAY 18, 2017 Solid stagnant juice from the masters of this style. You know the terrain by now. ItÂ’s thick with fruit pulp,a musty hop whiff and a dangerous sessionability. Just superb.

No fajne, fajne soczyÅ›cie chmielowe piwo, ale juÅ¼ widzÄ™, Å¼e przehajpowane. Piana obfita, ale podejrzanie szybko znika ze szkÅ‚a do minimalnych rozmiarÃ³w, jak na jasnego ale-a. Aromat i smak nie urywajÄ…, sÄ… po prostu ok, na pewno nie na TOP10 RB. Poprawne. Do tego alkohol jest delikatnie, ale wyczuwalny, co nie powinno mieÄ‡ miejsca. O klasÄ™ gorsze od v13, ktÃ³re piÅ‚em mniej Å›wieÅ¼e.

Special lunchtime trip to Brewdog Clerkenwell to sample on keg. Initially shocked by the cloudy appearance that was more like a milkshake or fruit smoothie. Nose was all hops and the same went for the flavour; pine, hops and more pine followed by extra hops. I didnÂ’t get the subtle fruit that I have encountered with previous Cloudwater DIPA releases. The texture was thick and the mouthfeel was dominated by the hop oils that lingered long after I got back to the office (it was a cheeky lunchtime trip after all)! Overall I admire the beer, but I really didnÂ’t like it. To me it lacks the subtlety that I have encountered with my favourite DIPA - Brew By Numbers 55/01 - and the range of fruit flavours that I got from Cloudwater DIPA V6. This was more akin to being assaulted by hops, although I wonÂ’t be pressing charges.

Keg at Brewdog Flagship. Pours deep hazy peachy yellowâ€‹. With a thin yellowy off white head. Nose of orange peel and soft fruits. Lots of fresh pine needles afterwards. The flavour has the tropical citrus notes but they are wrapped in an earthy quality that tones the experience down. It has light soft body and fizzy tight sparkle. The beer has a fantastic tropical citrus front brought quickly into check with an almost traditional earthy base. Superbly done.

Aroma: citrus, tropical fruits, herbs, spruce, cereal
Taste: medium bitter, light sweet, citrus, spruce, herbs

pale to orange in colour with no sign of a persistent head. wonderfully fruity aroma. had it fresh, so the first thing i noticed was the incredible hop character. citrus. tropical and a nice bitterness. up there with the best DIPAs in world in my opinion.
Keg at brewdog... Hazy amber... Thick white head... Soft dry floral orange.. Big soft passion fruit nose... Obviously a little cold... Little fizzy.. Sweet herbal floral orange... Big soft. Fruits

Can with props to Colin! Pours cloudy orange - bordering on OJ, with a medium off-white head and good lacing. Aroma is citra, tropical fruits, some pot and citrus passionfruit and mango. Flavor is light plus sweet and light bitter, super juicy with a nice dankness. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel. Excellent. These guys know NE IPAÂ’s better than the Â’Merican NE.

Can from Park Fever, Hither Green. Hazy orange pour with a swiftly dissipating white head. Aromas of apricot jam, peach skin, orange zest, corn. Rich zesty flavours of grapefruit, tangerine, mango, pineapple, lemon. Big juicy fruit linger. Long bittersweet finish. Lovely stuff.
duft. frisk citrus lime frisk appelsin smag frisk juice appelsin super frisk citrus lime

Great appearance, deep orange colour, very summery. Smooth sweet citrus aftertaste that lasts long after tasting. Great beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at BrewDog Shepherds Bush. Cloudy gold amber lasting cream head. Massive hit of fruit on the aroma. Melon lemon tangerine grapefruit. Then its caramel in mouth some sweetness. But easy drinking 9% finish is light and agile and more citrus fruits. Pineapple its pretty damn good. Worth the trip for it light dankness pretty good
Very light yellow, light white head. Mango. Sweet. Lightly dank. Slightly bitter. Quite sweet. Fairly dry. Chewy, light body. Excellent.

Can from Inn At Home, Guildford. Kinda weak farmyard resin pine amalgamation as far as the aroma goes. Solid light caramel in appearance. My wife looked disgusted! White head soon shrinks to the odd strand. Light citrus bitterness with sweet sugary strands. Herbs in my burp. Medium bodied. Silky smooth. Soft carbonation, equally soft finish. Was interested to see what I made of a much hyped beer and itÂ’s pretty awesome. Just slips down.
Tap @ Doghouse. Muddy yellow brown, reasonable head. Fruit juice hop aroma and flavour. Bitter bready aftertaste. This is great.

Brewdog Edinburgh keg. Pours like that dodgy hotel tropical juice. Thin head. Tingly citrus mouthfeel. Big complex tropical fruit taste. A few marks shy of excellent as it fades quickly and is a little too much about the citrus for me.

440ml can.In a Kwak yard glass. I bought this online from beer ritz.Zac is a great guy, and IÂ’d endorse buying from him. RichtheVillian gave this a 4.7, and thus I was determined to get boosted on this as a result. NW   resembles tropical fruit juice in its glowing vibrant sandy appearance. Tropicana drinks are free aroma. Flavours. Hops and booze crafted in an expression of skill and craftsmanship. IÂ’ll buy more cans for sure.

0,05l from tap at MBCC blue session shared with / by the crew. dark yellow cloudy color, small white head. smells of passion fruit, oats, mango, lightly grassy. very nice smell. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes of mango, some pines, passion fruit, light grapefruit, oats. finishes medium bitter with notes of mango, passion fruit and some grapefruit zest. very very nice taste, very tense and lovely balance. great stuff.

8, 4, 9, 4, 18

Can from Beer Hive. Cloudy ornage, white clingy head. Big juicy orange and tangerine nose. Medium body, sticky. Pretty bitter and a tang that might be the new manchester yeast? More juicy and sticky tangerine. Good stuff

Growler from Beer Gonzo, Coventry. Cloudy orange colour with a thin white head. Aroma is juicy citrus, tangerine, orange and grapefruit. Taste more of the same with a touch of pine. Bitter to the finish. Medium to full body. Very nice.

Tap, mbcc, blue. 
Hazy golden color, thin white head. 
Fruity, floral, hoppy, candy like aroma, tangerine. 
Flavor has, juice, sweetness, fruits, tangerine. Absolutely delicious. Wow.

Keg, Brewdog Leicester. Hazy yellow orange. Cloudy with a thin head. Peachy with chunky tropical fruit. Mango with grass and resinous pine. Sweet and juicy with contrasting bitterness. Dank grassiness, like the NE IPAs. Citrus rind. Pithy. Peppery alcohol despite this being so drinkable. Cloudwater getting close to perfection.
Tap at MBCC2017, Copenhagen. Color is cloudy golden with small white head. Aromas and flavors: Fruits, tropical fruits, hops and malts. Excellent.

UPDATED: MAY 12, 2017 Draught @ MBCC 2017. Pours cloudy hazy yellowish with a smooth head. Aroma of fresh juicy tropical fruits, pineapple, grapefruit, mango, citrus, grass and pine. Taste is hoppy, juicy and tropical fruity with some pineapple, mango, grass, citrus, pine and grapefruit. Finish is hoppy, bitter and grassy with some citrus, mild dankness, pineapple, juicy tropical notes and loads of fruits. Great.

Pours hazy yellow with low white head 
Aromas hoppy of mango, pine, resin, citrusy fruits 
Taste has notes of citrusy fruits, mango, pine, resin, lactose
Draft. An unclear yellow with a lazing yellowish head. The aroma has notes of lemons,hops, and straw. The flavor is sweet with nites of hops, lemons, malt, and straw, leading to a bitter finish.

UPDATED: MAY 15, 2017 9th May 2017Can. Citra, Simcoe, Huell Melon and Mosaic hops. Cloudy orange - gold beer, tidy pale cream colour head. Palate is smooth and fairly dry, good fine carbonation. Upfront hop spice. Bitter citrus, smooths out a little. Touch of fresh orange. Punchy mango. Light pine. Some creamy sweetness from the malts as they battle through the hop onslaught. Light dry spicy finish leaves a spicy bitter linger. Excellent stuff, a little more bitter than the numbered run of DIPAs. Not quite as complex as IÂ’d like it but I reckon this will develop more over the next 7 days or so. 4.1 Mother KellyÂ’s. Keg. Instant impression of a brighter fresher beer. Stunning combo of orange, lemon and grapefruit citrus supremely well joined up with mango led tropical fruits. That ubiquitos hop spice/burn makes this so very much more than a fruit smoothie as does the mild bitterness, the pine and the light creamy malt base. Exceptional. The new norm for Cloudwater DIPAs?

440ml can, only 2 weeks old. Cloudy opaque orange with a thin white head dissipating quite quickly. Aroma: juicy citrus fruits, orange, tangerine, pine, grapefruit. Taste: really juicy fruits, grapefruit, orange, tangerine, malts, strong bitterness. Medium body, average carbonation, slight stickiness. Perhaps a little less drinkable and more bitter than the latter v series, but really not much to complain about here. Top drawer stuff once again.

Pours cloudy golden with decent white head which diminishes quite quickly. Aromas of massive fresh pine hops with some citrus fruit and a hint of malt and tiny but of funk (in a good way). Low to medium carbonation but nice mouth feel. Taste is intense grassy hops with juicy tropical fruit. Not as full on as some of Cloudwaters recent DIPA v range but I like this drier edge. Finish is fairly dry, big bitterness and a very slight savoury/spice on the end.

UPDATED: MAY 14, 2017 May 2017 - 440ml can at home in Richmond, picked up in Realale Twickenham, as Â’Cloudwater NW DIPA CitraÂ’, 9%, hit the shops yesterday and its BB date is in 3 weeksÂ’ time! Pours an opaque cloudy orange, initial foamy off-white head dies quickly. Aroma is really fruity - lots of apricot, pineapple, grapefruit and some simple syrup alongside grassy hops. Body is quite light, tingly carbonation, touch frothy. Taste is assertive grassy hops, peachy sugars, like biting into some sort of bitter peach, mango and floral hops, warming booze showing up but not offputting. The Lees yeast gets a little distracting in the finish - maybe overly spicy and sticks in the throat a touch.  But what I love about this is that itÂ’s properly hoppy in a way a lot of New England IPAs arenÂ’t. It is currently averaging 4.4 and I didnÂ’t think there was any way it could meet that kind of expectation. But I was wrong. Wow. (4.4)
May 2017 - Another can at home watching Â’The StaircaseÂ’ documentary.  Picked up at Hop, Burns and Black.  Seems even spicier than last time.  Not quite showing the fruity vibrancy.  Probably wouldnÂ’t rate this as highly.

440ml can from BeerRitz. Pours a murky yellowy orange-gold colour with an off-white foam head that dissipates away and aroma of tropical fruits, citrus, pine, resiny hop. Taste is malt caramel, grain, oats well balanced with tropical fruity, spicy citrus, pine, hoppy, tangy bitterness. Lovely smooth mouthfeel, full bodied, soft carbonation, dry tangy slightly boozy finish. Very drinkable DIPA.

Can at home from Eebria, Thanks to Leighton for ordering. A clouded burnt golden coloured pout with a lasting sticky off white head. Aroma is ridiculously juicy fresh squeezed orange juice, big dank citrus hop, tangerine and hints of woody pine, and some sweet soft malts. Flavour is composed of medium sweet base malts with bread and rounded oats, big juicy dank citrus, orange and tangerine. Finishes with an intense woody pine bitterness. Really packs a punch. Little alcohol bite in the finish is a little distracting. . Nice spicy hop finish. Palate is full sweet and frothy, easy finish. Really good intense hoppy burp in the finish. Very good indeed.

UPDATED: MAY 16, 2017 Cans. Murky peach coloured body with a thin white head that quickly fades. Lively carbonation. No lacing. Aroma of pineapple, honey, peach, lemongrass and melon. Flavour of grass, melon and juicy pineapple with a bitter, peppery finish. Medium body with a slick, oily mouthfeel. Light fizz. Delicious. Lots of peppey hop burn.
440ml can. Pours murky orange with a small head. Aroma is papaya and pineapple, a little burnt alcohol. Taste has papaya. Sweet burnt pineapple medium bitter finish. Hoppy burps.

Can bier huis ossett. Beer 3 0f broads holiday. Just smashed the boat broke a window this is needed!!! Cloudy golden colour. Nice orange aroma. Taste is juicy orange big hoppy bitters no sign of abv. Nice and sticky very good

Another blinder from Cloudwater. These guys haved nailed the murky fruit juice IIPA. Pours an opaque orange colour, and is bursting full of pulpy, pithy tropical fruit, just enough pine and dank weedy stickiness. Not quite as good as V13 in my opinion, but a stunning example of the style nonetheless.

Keg at The Cloudwater Barrel Store, Manchester. A cloudy orange colour with a thin white head. Aroma of pineapple, passionfruit, mango, some tangerine, a little pine, a hint of bubblegum, a touch of biscuit and slight floral hops. Taste of passionfruit, tangerine, mango, some grapefruit, slight pineapple, a little biscuity malts, maybe oats and subtle floral hops. Medium bodied and an oily texture. A lingering, dryish, tropical fruit and floral hop bitterness in the finish. A lot more bitter than the DIPA V.Range but still as tropical as ever. Citrusy and subtley floral on the close with sweetness running through the silky body. Excellent.

Tropical fruits, zesty passion fruit, melon, overripe mango, sweet citrus fruits, tangerine, orange, some dankness, pine. Hazy, pale gold, small, creamy, white head. Medium sweet. More creamy tropical fruits, mango, passion fruit, citrus fruits, tangerine, sweet orange, some bitterness coming up, soft carbonation, medium bodied, bitter finish with some grass, wet straw and more citrus fruits. Outstanding IIPA, this I think, is absolute world class. Keg at The Hop Locker, Waterloo.

Keg at The Hop Locker, Southbank, London. A hazy, murky golden/orange coloured pour with a thin white head that doesnÂ’t hang about. Rich hoppy, mango, orange, tropical fruit on the nose. Tastes rich, hoppy, mango, orange, tropical fruit, some pineapple in there too with a slightly bitter finish. Definitely the best Cloudwater Imperial IPA that IÂ’ve had, theyÂ’ve dialled down the sweetness which is a big hit with me. What next from these guys?

It seems that everything these guys touch turns to gold. 
Wonderful aroma of mango draws you right in. 
Mouthfeel is thick and rich, giving way to stewed fruit taste with a hint of burn, but still so smooth. 
Lovely.

UPDATED: MAY 6, 2017 Can at home in London - sourced online. Pours cloudy orange-gold with a foamy, white head. The aroma is laughably intense, with lots of freshly squeezed tangerine and orange juice, some pine, mango, apricot. Honestly, the smell of this beer made me laugh. Medium sweet flavour with good stabilising bready pale malts, tons of juicy citrus, mild tropical notes, low bitterness, light pine, more apricot, peach, mango, tangerine. Medium to full bodied with fine to average carbonation. Finishes with light resinous pine, buckets more tangerine, mango, apricot and papaya, a hint of orange rind. Minimal warmth; really, the alcohol is barely apparent.This is quite outrageous stuff. Cloudwater hasnÂ’t missed a beat since finishing their initial DIPA series. As I expected, they have continued making spectacularly juicy, expressive DIPA. If this one is a good indication of their direction, then happy days are ahead.

Can from Tilt Brum; completely murky orange/amber pour with a little bubbly off white head, aroma leapt out as soon as I opened the can loads of pulpy mango, fresh pine, along with citrus, some dankness coming through, taste has an impressive blend of pine, mango, some bitter action, a sharp bite of citrus, wow need more cans.

Pours murky apple juice with low white head. Aroma of mango, passion fruit, peach, lime, fruit bomb! Taste is absolutely smashing, mikd fruity up front with a balanced bitterness in the lingering finish. Body is light and smooth with soft carbonation. A tad boozy but excellent.

Keg at Hop Locker. Pours murky orange with a thin white head that quickly vanishes. Aroma is juicy mango, um bongo, orange and a little pine. Taste is really light juicy mango, a little pineapple, pine resin and just a little zing of booze which leads to a perfectly bitter finishes. Carbonation is good. This is a cracking hop juice and possibly the best DIPA Cloudwater have made.

This has to be their best Dipa. I didnÂ’t like v13 to mango for me. It has a head that disappears very quickly. Very hazy which I like. Love the Citra and Simcoe hops used. They done well! More please.

UPDATED: MAY 8, 2017 Can fresh from the brewery via eebria, out of the box, into the fridge, straight in my face. It pours turbid, mega cloudy golden - orange with a decent white head. The aroma is rich, juicy, plump fruits, apricot, mango, peach, orange creamiscle, fruit smoothie, dragonfruit, some weed, grass, dank edge and crusty loaf of bread. The taste is crisp, dry, good bitter bite upfront and throughout, green, grassy, danky, pine needles, resinous, tannin, dried mango, guava, dragonfruit, passion fruit, good alcohol hit and some decent spice through the finish. Medium body and moderate, foamy carbonation. Rich and flavoursome with a good hop bite. A bit more punchy than the Dipa series perhaps, but not in a bad way. Delious. Cloudwater are killing it with their murky hop juice. 8, 4, 9, 5, 18 = 4.4. Re-rate. Second can had much more expressive and juicy aroma, so ratings has to be upgraded to 9, 4, 9, 5, 18 = 4.5.

Can at home, not heated up or stirred with a pen, 04/05/17.
Murky orange smoothie appearance with a well appointed light beige cap that retains well.
Nose is pineapple chunks, sticky mango sorbet, pine drool, semi dank hop exhaust, grapefuit, 
Taste comprises mango lassi, pine resin, sharp citric pith, toasted malts, tropical fruit medley, grapefruit.
Medium bodied, fine massaging carbonation pitched perfectly, finishes with semi aggressive dank hop bitterness.
Superb world class hop drool, balanced and eminently drinkable, pips DIPA13 for me on account of being that little bit sharper in the close.
15 more cans to go !
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Made a resolution to try many new beers during 2017 and stumbled across Cloudwater being based near my office. Lots of hype, but boy do they deliver. Not really had a beer like this one, so fruity and smooth. Again it looks stunning in the glass, and IÂ’m convinced there must be mango juice within to make a drink like this. For the alcohol content it is quite quaffable. Think IÂ’ll be trying everything from this brewery going forward, as their beers have been highlights of the year so far.

Fresh can from Cloudwater barrel store (27/4/17)
Drank side by side with Trillium Citra Cutting Tiles (canned 3/4/17)
Murky turbid burnt orange appearance. Foamy head, dissipating moderately quickly. Huge nose, over ripe papaya, mango and citrus, floral sweet honey as warms. 
Taste is overpowering! More overripe tropical/citrus fruit, followed rapidly by massive dank chewy resin and an almost acrid aftertaste. Malts barely get a look in. Tongue coating hop oils and a thick luxurious, slightly grainy, mouth feel. 
An overwhelming brute of a DIPA, lacks the smooth balance the great US NE IPAs demonstrate but highly impressive.

A world class DIPA and IÂ’ve tried a few of them now. This brewery is seriously evolving. 

Enjoy!

Tap. Cloudwater Barrel Store. Completely opaque, milkshake like, pale gold. Glossy topped, foamy, bubbly, lasting, off white head. Nose has ripe, fleshy citrus. Baked orange. Stewed stone fruit. Some pineapple flesh and mango. All of that with a trace of sweet and biscuity malts as a backdrop. Taste has soft and juicy, fleshy citrus bitterness. Sweet, and a little estery. Drinks really easy for the ABV. Foamy and soft on the palate. Feels 6% as opposed to 9. Light and fruity bitterness to finish. As good as v13. Awesome, in a word.
